feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Build
feed.subtitle: SAP Build Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: SBPA Process Scheduler Trigger : A Step-by-Step Demo on Invoice Validation Approval
entry.content:
Disclaimer: The insights shared in this blog are based on my personal observations and learning. They may not apply universally, and I encourage readers to conduct their own research and make an informed decision before using this content for productive use.

Welcome back to our SAP Build Process Automation series! In this third blog, we'll dive deep into one of the most crucial aspects of process automation: how to automatically start business processes using scheduler. 

What Are Scheduled Triggers?

Scheduled triggers enable you to automate the initiation of business processes at predefined intervals, eliminating the need for manual intervention or dependency on external events. By defining a time-based schedule, you can ensure that processes run exactly when you want them to, whether that’s daily, weekly, monthly, or following a custom recurrence pattern.

Key Benefits:

  • Hands-free automation – Processes start automatically without user action.
  • Enhanced efficiency – Streamlines operations by reducing delays and human error.
  • Lower manual workload – Frees up resources for higher-value activities.
  • Consistent execution – Ensures tasks run on time, every time.
  • Flexible scheduling – Supports a wide range of recurrence patterns to suit business needs.

Prerequisites

Before starting, ensure you have:

  1. Access to SAP Build Process Automation
  2. A working process (we'll use the vendor invoice validation approval process project from previous episodes)
  3. BTP Cockpit access for service key retrieval - trial cockpit

Step-by-Step Implementation 

Phase 1: Project Setup

Step 1: Create a Copy of Your Existing Project from previous blog

  1. Navigate to SAP Build Lobby
  2. Locate your existing project (e.g., "Invoice Validation Approval Process Form")
  3. Select the project by clicking on it
  4. Click "Save As" to create a copy
  5. Enter new project details: 
    1. Project Name: Invoice Validation Approval Process Scheduler 
    2. Description: A invoice validation and approval process scheduler
  6. Click "Save" to create the new project   

Step 2: Access and Prepare the Process

  1. Open the newly created project
  2. Navigate to the process section
  3. You should see:
    • Four forms
    • One process
    •  Existing form scheduler (Invoice Validation Approval Process Form)

Phase 2: Removing Existing Process and Adding Scheduled Trigger

Step 3: Remove the Existing Form Process and add the scheduled trigger

  1. Click on the existing form process (Invoice Validation Approval Process Form)
  2. Click "Remove" to delete the form
  3. You'll now see a block asking "How do you want to start your process?"
  4. Click "Add a scheduled trigger

Step 4: Create the Scheduled Trigger

  1. Click on "Scheduled Trigger"
  2. Save the process (mandatory before creating Scheduled trigger)
    • Click the Save button
  3. Configure Scheduled Trigger Details: 
    • Name: Invoice Validation Approval Process Scheduled Trigger 
    • Identifier: [Auto-generated - do not modify]
  4. Click "Create"
  5. You'll see a success message: "Scheduled trigger created successfully"  

Phase 3: Configure the Process Inputs

Step 5: Examine Scheduler Trigger Properties

  1. Click on the Scheduler trigger you just created
  2. Review Output Fields:
  • These are automatically synchronized from process inputs
  • Fields include: Vendor Name, Invoice Number, Invoice Date, Vendor Email, Invoice Amount, Due Date

Phase 4: Project Release and Deployment 

Step 6: Release the Project

  1. Save all changes
  2. Click "Release" button in the top toolbar
  3. Confirm the release when prompted
  4. Wait for successful release message

Click on the "Release" button, add the release notes (Optional) and click on the Release.

Step 7: Deploy the Project

  1. Click "Deploy" button (appears after release)
  2. Select target environment (typically "Public Environment")
  3. Confirm deployment
  4. Wait for deployment completion
  5. Note the deployment success message

Phase 5: Accessing Deployment Information 

Step 8: Navigate to Control Tower

  1. Go to SAP Build Lobby home
  2. Click on "Control Tower"
  3. Navigate to "Tenant Configuration"
  4. Click on "Environments"
  5. Select "Public Environment" (or your deployment target)

Step 9: Locate Your Deployed Project

  1. Find your project: "Invoice Validation Approval Process Scheduled Trigger"
  2. Click on the project name
  3. Navigate to "Triggers" tab
  4. Locate: "Invoice Validation Approval Process Scheduled Trigger"

Phase 6: Configure the Scheduled Trigger

Step 10: Activate the Trigger

  1. Click on the three dots under Actions
  2. Select "Activate"

Step 11: Schedule Configuration

  1. Schedule Tab Settings
    1. Date Range: August 14th, 2025 to August 25th, 2026 (1-month subscription)
    2. Time Zone: IST (Indian Standard Time)
    3. Recurrence: 5 month (monthly execution)
    4. Start Time: 9:43 MM
    5. Day Number: 1st day of every month
  2. Recurrence Options Available
    1. Minutes: Maximum 59 minutes
    2. Hours: Maximum 24 hours
    3. Days: Maximum 7 days
    4. Weeks: Maximum 35 weeks
    5. Months: Maximum 12 months

Step 12: Input Parameters

  1. Configure Input Data
    1. Switch to "Input Parameter" tab
    2. Enter the following sample data:
      1. Vendor Name
      2. Invoice Number
      3. Invoice Date
      4. Vendor Email
      5. Invoice Amount
      6. Due Date
  2. Activate Configuration
    1. Click "Activate"
    2. The trigger will be successfully updated

Phase 7: Testing and Monitoring

Step 13: Test Immediate Execution

  • After activation, you'll see new options under "Actions":
    • Disable trigger
    • Run now (for testing)
    • Edit trigger configuration
  • Click "Run now" for testing

Step 14: Monitor Process Instance

  1. Return to SAP Build Lobby
  2. Navigate to "Monitoring"
  3. Click "Process and Workflow Instances"
  4. Locate your new process instance:
    • Status: Running
    • Instance ID: [Auto-generated]
    • Started by: Scheduled Trigger

Step 15: Review Process Data

  1. Click on the process instance
  2. Review "Process Details":
    • Vendor Name: TEST VENDOR
    • Invoice Number: 1234
    • Invoice Amount: 1000
    • Vendor Email: test-vendor@test.com
    • Due Date: 2024-08-16

    3. Check process flow: Should be waiting for approval

Step 16: Review all the details and Approve the process form

Step 17: Verify Process Completion

  1. Return to "Process and Workflow Instances"
  2. Refresh the page
  3. Check your process instance:
    • Status: Completed
    • All approval messages visible
    • Complete process flow executed 

Conclusion

Scheduled triggers in SAP Build Process Automation offer a robust and flexible way to automate recurring business processes without manual intervention.

Through the vendor invoice validation approval prcess example, we see how such triggers can streamline operations, maintain consistency, and enhance efficiency by executing workflows at precise intervals. By carefully configuring schedules, input parameters, and approval steps, organizations can reduce errors, optimize resources, and scale their automation efforts.

However, success depends on thorough testing, proper security measures, and continuous monitoring to ensure reliability and performance in production environments.

entry.title: SAP Build - Get Record fetches data but properties are blank when I try to read them
entry.content:
Hey,

I'm trying to read a single data record into an app or data variable. The API works and fetches the data.

So when I output the record, I do get the object with all of the information and properties. However, when I try to read or bind one of the properties of that object to a field or variable, the result is always empty. Same thing happens when I use the Get record / Record output to bind it to a variable that was created from the same entity.

I just use the basic Get record and Set data variable/Set app variable logic.

Thanks for your help!

entry.title: SAP Build Process Automation - Automation does not complete/finish
entry.content:
Dear community,

i sat up an workflow in SAP Build Process Automation. The trigger is a pretty basic formular which i need to submit. After that, my automation starts. But here is the problem: the automation starts, executes properly but never comes to finish.

Furthermore, the output parameter of the automation is filled properly, available in the workflow but cant be used due to the fact that the automation is never stopping/completed or somehow finished. In the screenshots below and attached to this question i provided details about this issue. What can i do that the automation comes to an end?

The automation itself works in the tests without any issue and all the values are correctly parsed and mapped. It just doesn't continue as you can see in the screenshots and therefore no further steps in the workflow are executed.

Here are further screenshots additionally to the screenshots in the attachments:

entry.title: Re: SAP Build Process automation mail notification
entry.content: I think this post should be moved to the Technology Q&A part of SAP Community.

entry.title: Network error on Sap Build
entry.content:
Hello,

I have a mobile application which I made with Sap Build Web and Mobile Application( formerly known as Appgywer ). I am using an oData service on my app. It was working fine but suddenly oData service started to throw exception as "Network Error Axios Error: Network Error". 

Does anybody face same issue?

Best regards.

entry.title: Page Mounted Event not called in published app
entry.content:
Hey,

I implemented some logic that a record collection is called when the page was mounted.

In the preview this works just fine, but when I publish the app, it seems like the event istn't even called. I placed toast after every action in the logic tab and the first toasts (after Page mounted & Page focused) aren't showing up.

Did someone have this issue before?

entry.title: Performance difference between SAP BTP Free Account and Paid Account?
entry.content:
Hi Community,

I’m currently working with an SAP BTP Free Account and I’ve noticed some performance limitations when running applications and services (for example, SAP Build Apps, CAP services, and OData calls).

Before moving to a paid account, I’d like to understand:

  • Are there any performance differences (speed, responsiveness, system resources) between Free and Paid accounts?

  • Do paid accounts get more consistent service levels (e.g., CPU/memory allocation, faster response times, higher quotas)?

  • Is there any official documentation or benchmarks comparing Free vs. Paid accounts?

I’d really appreciate insights from anyone who has tested both environments or moved from Free to Paid.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Build Code Is Slow to Load and Won’t Open Properly
entry.content:
When I try to launch Build Code, it takes a long time to load and never fully starts. It remains stuck on the screen shown in the attached image.

Occasionally, it does open, but the storyboard is blank and the Joule tab doesn’t have a place to enter prompts. Is anyone else experiencing this issue? If a solution or workaround exists, please let me know.

entry.title: SAP Document AI - item splitted to 2 pages
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

In SAP Document AI (Premium version), I run into a limitation when invoices or other documents contain line items that are split across two pages.

Instead of treating them as one item, the service always creates two separate items. I know this is a known limitation, but I’m trying to understand if there are any workarounds or configuration options that can help.

So far I’ve tried:

  • Enabling Instant Learning

  • Setting dataFeedbackCollection = true

…but it doesn’t improve the results.

  • Has anyone found a reliable way to handle split line items?

  • Are there service settings or template tricks that help?

  • Or is post-processing/merging the only practical solution at this point?

Would love to hear how others are dealing with this.

Thank you

entry.title: Facing issues while using sales order visibility scenario in sap build process automation.
entry.content:
While working on the Sales Order Management (MI03) template in SAP Build Process Automation, I customized the Determine Approver step and set up the approval flow. The process runs smoothly — forms are submitted, inbox tasks appear, and confirmation emails are triggered correctly.

To enable visibility, I followed SAP’s tutorial:
https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/spa-create-process-visibility.html

However, the visibility scenario doesn’t appear under Monitoring in SAP Build Lobby as expected.

So I deployed it and accessed it via SAP Build Work Zone, following this guide:
https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/spa-configure-workzone.html

The dashboard loads successfully, but all panels — including open instances, completed instances, cycle time, and step-level metrics — show no data available.


SAP Build Process Automation 
SAP Build 

@KarthikeyanMurthy 
@PierreCol 
@Dan_Wroblewski

entry.title: Reclass of non-open item GL Balances
entry.content:
Dear All,

We has some GLs with non-open Item management need to reclass to item management before update GL master data

while I run the BOT with SAP Build Project -  Proposed Reclassification of G/L Account Entries (5AK)

the selection entries as below

https://api.sap.com/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_OPLACCTGDOCITEMCUBE_SRV/A_OperationalAcctgDocItemCube?$inlinecount=allpages&$select=CompanyCode,GLAccount,FiscalYear,LedgerGroup,AccountingDocument,AccountingDocumentItem,AccountingDocumentType,AmountInTransactionCurrency,Reference2InDocumentHeader,DebitCreditCode,PostingDate,TransactionCurrency,ProfitCenter,CostCenter&$filter=CompanyCode eq 'XXXX' and (GLAccount eq 'xxxxxxxxxx') and PostingDate ge datetime'2024-10-01T00:00:00' and PostingDate le datetime'2025-09-28T23:59:59' and (LedgerGroup eq '' or LedgerGroup eq '0L') and (AccountingDocumentType eq 'SA')

compare the output result from above API and the output from the App "Display Line Items in General Ledger"

can you please help with the filter for API calls with have same result with App "Display Line Items in General Ledger"

please note my GL account is non-item management

Many thanks,

Patrick

entry.title: Queuing of SAP GUI background processes after BPA bot closes session
entry.content:
When the SAP GUI recorder finishes processing by the BPA bot, I notice that multiple SAP GUI icons remain queued in the system tray. Once I hover the mouse over them, they disappear automatically.
My concern is whether these “ghost” sessions could cause problems on the machine.
Is there a way to ensure that SAP GUI sessions are completely terminated after the bot closes the connection?

Environment:
SAP Build Process Automation (BTP)
Desktop Agent (version …)
SAP GUI 7.8 / Logon 800

entry.title: How to handle unexpected pop-up windows in SAP GUI recording with SAP Build Process Automation?
entry.content:
Hello Community,

I am currently working with SAP Build Process Automation (BPA) and I have a recording in SAP GUI that executes a bot.
The issue is that sometimes, when starting the SAP session, an unexpected pop-up window appears (for example due to updates, maintenance, or security certificates). These windows do not always show up, and when they do, they break the bot execution because they are not part of the recording.

What is the best practice to handle such occasional pop-up windows in an SAP GUI recording?
Is there a recommended way to manage them without having to record every possible case manually?

Thank you for your support!

entry.title: SAP Desktop Agent starts and disappears during automation
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I’m facing an issue with SAP Intelligent RPA Desktop Agent (v3.32.58, Unattended mode). When I run my automation, the agent starts but immediately disappears without executing, and status goes back to Idle – Connected to tenant, waiting for a project to be loaded.

Any guidance on fixing this (reinstall, deployment settings, or log checks) would be appreciated.

Thanks!

entry.title: How can i export and import a SAP Build Apps project?
entry.content:
Hello,

I have a SAP Build Apps project on a BTP Trial account. now the Account expires and i need to create a new one. How can i export the SAP Build Apps project from the expirering account and import it on the new one?

What i tried:
- i exported/downloaded the .mtar file from the Build and Deploy menu.
- i tried importing the .mtar file in the Import menu in the SAP Build Lobby, but the upload errors with "File type is invalid"


Is there another way to do this?

Best regards,
Finn Ole Hoppe

entry.title: SAP GUI Automation within SAP BPA Workflow Process
entry.content:
Hello everyone, 

I am building a process in SAP Build Process Automation where:

  • A user manually fills an input form and clicks Submit. Based on the input dropdown/select values and other conditions, the workflow should trigger automation that perform a sequence of steps inside SAP GUI (open transaction, input fields, save).

What I want to know/Problems i am trying to solve:

  1. Can I include SAP GUI recording-based automation inside a BPA workflow? 
  2. Should I design this as attended or Unattended? Which is best fit when the workflow must continue after form submission without user interaction?
  3. Any best practices for login, error handling, and scaling such automations?
  4. Would it be better to use APIs instead of GUI automation when possible?

Any ample patterns (form --> workflow --> automation --> email) would be very helpful.

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Error while subscribing to SAP BUILD APPS and SAP BPA in trail account
entry.content:
Hi experts,

I’m facing an issue while subscribing to SAP Build Apps and SAP Build Process Automation from the SAP BTP cockpit.

When I try to subscribe, I get the error message - that i have attached 

 

I’ve already tried the following steps:

  1. Checked entitlements and quotas for the subaccount

  2. Verified role collections

But the error still appears.

Could you please help me understand what might be causing this and how to fix it?

Thanks in advance for your support!

entry.title: Request failed with status code 503 in SAP BUILD CODE
entry.content:
Hello All,

We’re trying to connect our backend SAP S/4HANA system with SAP Build Code, but we’re getting a 503 Service Unavailable error during integration.
Could someone please guide us on what configuration might be missing?

 

Step we followed so far..

1, In BTP Cockpit, Establish a Destination xxx_xx_BuildCode with Basic Authentication with Additional properties as 

sap.processautomation.enabled=true
MobileEnabled=true
WebIDEEnabled=true
WebIDEUsage=odata_abap,dev_abap,odata_c4c,odata_gen,apihub_sandbox
sap.build.usage=odata_gen
HTML5.DynamicDestination=true
isCatalog=true
sap.applicationdevelopment.actions.enabled=true
product.name=SAP S/4HANA
BuildApps.Enabled=true
HTML5.ForwardAuthToken=true
BuildApps.ApiType=odata,rest
appgyver.Enabled=true
Authentication=BasicAuthentication
HTML5.Timeout=60000

2. Verified in BTP Cockpit → Destination shows “Reachable”

3. Opened SAP Build App → Control Tower → Add Destination and successfully added the same destination.

4, Created a project (Web + Mobile) → Navigated to Integration tab → Add Integration → BTP Destination → Selected the same destination. At this point, we receive the error:

Has anyone experienced this issue before or can suggest possible reasons for this 503 error?

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: SAP Build Apps Multi Combo Box binding (F4) shows nothing but I can see data in integration tab
entry.content:
Hi Experts , 

I am binding multi combo box in sap build apps  using mapping .  I can browse through data in integration tab in sap build apps.

but the the multi combobox   is not giving any value  on F4. 

Regards,

Gaurang

entry.title: Unable to see Marketplace, REST based Integration etc in SAP Build App as part of Build Portfolio
entry.content:
When subscribed for SAP Build Apps from SAP Build Portfolio - then many features are not available as comp aired to standalone SAP Build Apps subscription .

Example :

Market Place

REST based Integration 

 

Anything I am missing ??
